QuestionTxt:
(Do the following statements make you more or less favorable towards Hillary Clinton?)...Beats back the GOP: Hillary Clinton is the only candidate who has withstood 15 years of assaults from the Republican attack machine and come out stronger. She has won two landslide elections in New York, winning 58 of New York's 62 counties, including 90% of the counties where George (W.) Bush beat John Kerry.
Democrats can't afford to lose another presidential election. There's too much at stake for our country. Hillary knows how to take on the Republican attack machine and win.
StudyNote: This survey was conducted on behalf of Hillary Clinton. These data have been made available with the support of the Society of Presidential Pollsters and the Special Collections Research Center, George Washington Libraries and Academic Innovation, The George Washington University. QuestionTxt: For each of the following individuals, please select if you have a favorable or unfavorable impression of that person. If you don't know enough about the person to have an opinion, you can say that too....John Kerry
StudyNote: The poll was fielded by GfK Knowledge Networks using its national KnowledgePanel.  The KnowledgePanel is a nationally representative probability sample of the U.S. adult population. Panelists are recruited by randomly selecting residential addresses using a process called address-based sampling (ABS). Since nearly 3-in-10 U.S. households do not have home Internet access, respondent households who do not have Internet access or own a computer are provided Internet service and a netbook computer to ensure that panel respondents are representative of the U.S. adult population. Unlike opt-in panels, households are not permitted to 'self-select' into KnowledgePanel; nor are they allowed to participate in many surveys per week.

QuestionTxt: (Now, I'd like to rate your feelings toward some people and organizations, with one hundred meaning a very warm, favorable feeling, zero meaning a very cold, unfavorable feeling, and fifty meaning not particularly warm or cold.  You can use any number from zero to one hundred, the higher the number the more favorable your feelings are toward that person or organization.  If you have no opinion or never heard of that person or organization, please say so.)...John Kerry...Give...John Kerry...a rating with 100 meaning a very warm, favorable feeling, zero meaning a very cold, unfavorable feeling, and 50 meaning not particularly warm or cold. (If Don't know, ask:) Would you say you are unable to give an opinion of...John Kerry, or have you never heard of...John Kerry?
StudyNote: National likely voters are registered voters who voted in the 2004 presidential election and said they are probably or almost certain to vote in the 2006 election.

QuestionTxt: (Now, I'd like to rate your feelings toward some people and organizations, with one hundred meaning a very warm, favorable feeling, zero meaning a very cold, unfavorable feeling, and fifty meaning not particularly warm or cold.  You can use any number from zero to one hundred, the higher the number the more favorable your feelings are toward that person or organization.  If you have no opinion or never heard of that person or organization, please say so.)...John Kerry...Give...John Kerry a rating, with 100 meaning a very warm, favorable feeling, zero meaning a very cold, unfavorable feeling, and 50 meaning not particularly warm or cold. (If Don't know, ask:) Would you say you are unable to give an opinion of...John Kerry, or have you never heard of...John Kerry?
StudyNote: National registered likely voters are registered voters who voted in the 2000 presidential election/were ineligible/too young to vote or who didn't vote in the 2000 election, but did vote in the 2002 election and said they will probably or are almost certain to vote in the 2004 presidential election.

John Edwards lost his 2004 campaign for president to John Kerry and he lost his campaign for vice president as John Kerry's running mate. Edwards left the United States Senate after serving only one term, and has never won another election before or since. We need a proven winner as president, not an inexperienced candidate who can't stand up effectively to Republican attacks. Does this make you more or less favorable to John Edwards?...Much less favorable, somewhat less favorable, more favorable
SourceDoc: PSB April 2007 South Carolina Polling Report
SampleDesc: Registered likely South Carolina primary voters
StudyNote: This survey was conducted on behalf of Hillary Clinton. These data have been made available with the support of the Society of Presidential Pollsters and the Special Collections Research Center, George Washington Libraries and Academic Innovation, The George Washington University. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for access to materials in the Mark Penn Digital Polling Data Collection and Oral History. Speccoll@gwu.edu

SampleDesc: National Hispanic registered likely voters (see note)
StudyNote: National Hispanic registered likely voters are Hispanic registered voters who voted in the 2000 presidential election/were ineligible/too young to vote or who didn't vote in the 2000 election but did vote in the 2002 election and said they will probably vote or are almost certain to vote in the 2004 presidential election.  The survey included an oversample of 559 Hispanic registered likely voters in Southwestern swing states Arizona, New Mexico, and Nevada, and an oversample of 363 non-Cuban Hispanics in Florida.  Results are weighted to be representative of the national Hispanic registered likely voters sample.
